  "title": "Architect II / Project Architect",
  "description": "PG Consulting Limited is a recruitment, training and business consulting firm. We provide our clients - businesses and corporate organizations - across different industries with superior human capital, high-quality trainings and cutting-edge consulting to help them drive organizational growth, multiply staff productivity, gain appropriate market positioning and maximise profit.

Over the course of almost 20 years of our existence, we have serviced various organizations, many of which are strong indigenous brands operating with global standards. We are most inclined to building strong brands and supporting business growth across industries. Our preference is to work with our clients as partners on an on-going basis towards making their organizations internally effective and more profitable.&nbsp;As we grow into the future, the sustaining core of our operations is working with you, all the way, from People to Profit.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Architect II / Project Architect
Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type:Full-time
Department: Design &amp; Construction
Reports to: Senior Architect / Design Manager

Job Summary


	The Architect II / Project Architect plays a pivotal role in the design, coordination, and execution of architectural projects.
	This position requires a strong blend of creative and technical expertise to lead projects from concept through construction.
	The ideal candidate will manage design teams, oversee consultants, and serve as the point of contact with clients and contractors, ensuring projects are delivered on time, within scope, and to high-quality standards.


Key Responsibilities
Design and Documentation:


	Lead the development of architectural design concepts and translate them into detailed drawings and documentation.
	Prepare and oversee the preparation of architectural presentations, working drawings, and construction documents.
	Ensure designs comply with local regulations, codes, and zoning requirements.


Project Management:


	Manage medium to large-scale projects or multiple smaller projects simultaneously.
	Develop project schedules, monitor progress, and ensure deadlines are met.
	Coordinate with internal teams and external consultants (MEP, structural, landscape, etc.) for integrated project delivery.
	Conduct site visits and monitor construction to ensure adherence to design intent and quality standards.


Client and Stakeholder Engagement:


	Serve as the primary liaison between the firm and clients for assigned projects.
	Lead design and coordination meetings, incorporating client feedback into evolving project documents.
	Present design concepts and solutions to clients and regulatory bodies.


Team Leadership and Mentorship:


	Supervise and mentor junior architects and interns, providing guidance on design development and professional growth.
	Conduct quality reviews of documentation produced by junior team members.


Qualifications


	Education: Master&#39;s Degree in Architecture.
	Experience: 4 - 7 years of professional architectural experience, with 2 years in a project leadership role being an added advantage.
	Licensure: Registered Architect or on licensure track preferred.


Technical Skills:


	Proficiency in design and drafting software: AutoCAD, Revit (mandatory), SketchUp, Adobe Creative Suite.
	Strong understanding of construction detailing, materials, and methods.
	Familiarity with Nigerian Building Codes, Planning Regulations, and international best practices.


Soft Skills:


	Strong design sensibility and attention to detail.
	Excellent communication, organizational, and time management skills.
	Ability to work independently and as part of a multidisciplinary team.


Salary Range
N400,000 - N500,000 monthly (Based on experience level and projects handled).

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Applications &nbsp;and Portforlio to:&nbsp;jobs@pgconsultingng.com&nbsp;using&nbsp;the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Data Entry Pharmacy Technician Job at Castville Solutions




        
    

        
        Castville Solutions is a recruitment and business solutions provider specializing in the healthcare sector. We focus on connecting healthcare facilities with highly skilled professionals, enabling efficient operations, and driving business growth. Our services extend to recruitment, Templates for process and operations management, SOP development, and healthcare-specific training, with a clear mission to transform the healthcare workforce and operations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Data Entry Pharmacy Technician

Job Location: Artillery, Port Harcourt - Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a Data Entry Pharmacy Technician who is responsible for accurately entering and maintaining prescription information in the pharmacy system, ensuring timely and precise processing of medication orders.


Key Responsibilities


	Enter prescription information, patient details, and insurance data into pharmacy systems with accuracy and efficiency.
	Verify prescription orders for completeness, correctness, and compliance with regulations.
	Communicate with prescribers, patients, and insurance companies to resolve data or coverage issues.
	Maintain and update patient records, ensuring confidentiality and compliance with HIPAA regulations.
	Assist pharmacists in preparing, labeling, and organizing medication orders.


Qualifications & Skills


	OND/ HND or equivalent (required).
	Certified Pharmacy Technician (CPhT) or state licensure (as applicable).
	Previous experience in pharmacy or healthcare data entry preferred.
	Strong attention to detail and accuracy in data entry.
	Proficiency with pharmacy software systems and Microsoft Office Suite.


Salary
N100,000 monthly.

Note: For more information, contact the recruiter via WhatsApp on: 09010634633.

Department: Knowledge Management and Communication
Reports to: MEAL Officer

Project overview


	DEC is implementing the CASCADE Project (2022&ndash;2026), a multi-country initiative funded by the Government of the Netherlands and led by CARE International.
	The project aims to enhance food security and reduce malnutrition among 1.1 million women of reproductive age (15&ndash;49 years) and children under 15 years by promoting access to healthy diets and strengthening resilience to price and climate-related shocks.


Summary of Position


	The Communications and Learning Assistant will support the implementation of communication strategies across all project activities.
	In addition, the Assistant will provide oversight for the project&rsquo;s communication initiatives, including design, content quality, and overall consistency.

Communication &amp; Visibility:


	Support in documenting CASCADE activities in Nasarawa through photography, videography, and field notes.
	Draft success stories, human-interest stories, case studies, and social media content highlighting project impacts.

	Ensure timely media coverage and manage local media relations during project events. Knowledge Management &amp; Learning
	Support the development of learning briefs, reports, and documentation of best practices.
	Assist in organizing learning events, workshops, and community dialogues.
	Contribute to the collection and curation of data, quotes, and testimonies from beneficiaries for knowledge products.
	Maintain a communication repository (photos, videos, stories, reports) for DEC and CASCADE.


Capacity Strengthening:


	Provide support to community structures and DEC field teams in documentation and communication practices.
	Assist in training community volunteers, extension workers, and women leaders on basic storytelling and documentation tools.


Aministrative Coordination:


	Liaise with CARE Nigeria communication team to align state-level communication outputs with national strategies.
	Support logistics for field visits, media engagements, and workshops.
	Prepare activity reports and contribute quarterly communication updates.


Academic Qualifications and Experience


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree or Higher National Diploma in Communications, Mass Communication, Journalism, Development Studies, or related field.
	Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience in communications, media, or development sector (volunteering/internship experience will be considered).


Core Competence:


	Proven skills in photography, videography, and basic graphic design (Canva, Photoshop, CorelDraw, or similar tools).
	Strong writing skills with the ability to craft compelling stories from the field.
	Familiarity with social media management and digital communication strategies.
	Ability to work in rural communities with sensitivity to gender and cultural contexts.
	Good time management skills with ability to handle multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
	Proactive, resourceful, solutions oriented and results-oriented
	Excellent organization, planning and analytical skills; detail oriented.

	Applications will be shortlisted on a rolling basis

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Factory Operations Manager",
  "description": "Elizabeth Maddeux Limited -&nbsp;Our client is a world leader in manufacturing construction chemicals and building solutions for virtually any type of construction project, combining high-quality products, expert technical support, customer service, and innovation.

They are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Factory Operations Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Sagamu, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Operations
Reports To: Directors
Job Mode: Onsite
Industry: Construction/ Manufacturing

Role Summary


	The Factory Operations Manager for Costarchem Nigeria will oversee the efficient functioning of the factory, ensuring optimal production processes, quality control, and research and development (R&amp;D) for innovative chemical products.
	This role involves coordinating production planning and forecasting, managing vendor relationships, ensuring compliance with Nigerian regulatory bodies, and liaising with government agencies.
	The position requires an experienced leader to drive productivity while maintaining high standards in safety, quality, and operational efficiency.


Key Responsibilities
Human Management:


	Supervise and manage a team of production staff, including training, development, and performance management.
	Foster a positive and productive work environment, promoting employee engagement and retention.
	Ensure compliance with HR policies, labor laws, and regulations.


Planning:


	Develop and implement production plans, schedules, and budgets to meet business objectives.
	Coordinate with sales, marketing, and procurement teams to ensure alignment and effective communication.
	Analyze production data and market trends to inform planning decisions.


Production:


	Oversee the production process, ensuring quality, efficiency, and safety standards are met.
	Implement and maintain quality control processes, including inspection and testing.
	Troubleshoot production issues, identifying and implementing corrective actions.


Vendor Management:


	Develop and maintain relationships with suppliers and vendors.
	Negotiate contracts, prices, and delivery terms to ensure optimal value.
	Monitor vendor performance, addressing any issues or concerns.


Logistics Management:


	Coordinate the receipt, storage, and dispatch of raw materials, work-in-progress, and finished goods.
	Ensure effective inventory management, minimizing waste and optimizing stock levels.
	Develop and implement logistics strategies to improve efficiency and reduce costs.


Reports Writing:


	Prepare and submit regular reports on production performance, quality, safety, and inventory management.
	Analyze data and provide insights to inform business decisions.
